subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: The FTP Server source code resides in the Apache Subversion (SVN) repository.
The command-line SVN client can be obtained here.
The TortoiseSVN GUI client for Windows can be obtained here. There are also SVN plugins available for both Eclipse and IntelliJ IDEA.

subsection.name: Web Access (read-only)
subsection.p: The source code can be browsed via the Web at http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/incubator/ftpserver/. No SVN client software is required.

subsection.name: Anonymous Access (read-only)
subsection.p: The SVN URL for anonymous users is http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ftpserver/. Instructions for anonymous SVN access are here.

subsection.name: Committer Access (read-write)
subsection.p: The SVN URL for committers is https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ftpserver/. Instructions for committer SVN access are here.

subsection.name: Access Via a Proxy
subsection.p: SVN clients can go through a proxy if you configure them to do so. The Subversion FAQ describes how to configure the command-line client to use a proxy. To configure TortoiseSVN to use a proxy, go to "TortoiseSVN Settings > Network".
